entry.title: [test] Suppress generation of stack traces in death tests
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/1246434, we suppressed symbolized stack traces in

death test child procs. While this worked for CHECK and DCHECK messages,

it did not catch other code, such as ObserverList, that may do its own

symbolization. In this change, we switch to suppressing symbolization in

death test child procs in base::StackTrace itself. This avoids the need

to chase down all callers and catch new callers.



Bug: 1517343

Change-Id: I897b13b6326c7627e3fa56b4a34ad0d771762996

entry.title: Move address pref logic from PDM to ADM
entry.content:
See go/split-pdm. This CL:

- Injects the PrefService into the ADM.

- Moves IsAutofillProfileEnabled() to the ADM, updating all the few

callers.

- Moves the IsAutofillProfileEnabled() override to the TestADM.

- Moves listening for changes to kAutofillProfileEnabled and reloading

profiles to the ADM.

- Moves the check for IsAutofillProfileEnabled() in PDM::AddProfile() to

ADM::AddProfile(). This allows removing the override in the TestPDM.

- Moves the caching of the default country for new addresses into the

ADM, since this is supposed to be cleared when the pref changes. See

CL comments.

- Keeps TestPDM::SetAutofillProfileEnabled(), but forwards the call to

the TestADM, since this has quite a few callers and requires OWNER

approval for several non-components/autofill directories.



Bug: b/322170538

Change-Id: Ic9a6392e79278a1d7ef161f1d493bef543e05414

entry.title: [ios] Avoid LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node() to iterate all bookmarks
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



This patch is part of a larger series to remove all callers for

LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node(), which doesn't have clear semantics

during the transition phase while feature

`syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is rolling out.



For cases where the root is used to iterate all its children, the only

solution inherent to the LegacyBookmarkModel abstraction is to list all

permanent folders explicitly on the caller's side. Subtly enough, this

may include the managed node, which is now exposed as a new getter in

LegacyBookmarkModel.



This allows LegacyBookmarkModelWithSharedUnderlyingModel to offer

equivalent behavior, without accidentally leaking all 6 (or 7) permanent

folders, when the actual intention is to only expose a subset.



One special case is bookmark_utils_ios::DeleteBookmarks(), which is

cleaner to implement by extending LegacyBookmarkModel with a dedicated

API.



Bug: 326185948

Change-Id: Ib74154ce417af3046a97df531d32fffd1f455cdc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5359206

Commit-Queue: Mikel Astiz

Reviewed-by: Arthur Milchior

Reviewed-by: Olivier Robin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271538}

entry.title: viz: Do not crash on software copy result for root surface eviction
entry.content:
Currently, EvictionHandler will crash if the CopyOutputResult it

receives does not have a texture result. This can happen during software

rendering. This CL has EvictionHandler fall back to a solid color quad

in this case.



In the future, we should handle the SkBitmap produced here.



Bug: 329061366

entry.title: Update screenOrientationProvider to check DisplayMode() for Fullscreen.
entry.content:
IsFullscreen() does not return True when a progressive web app is opened

in fullscreen.

GetDisplayMode() does update when a progressive web app is opened in

fullscreen.



LockOrientation() should only throw error

SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LOCK_RESULT_ERROR_FULLSCREEN_REQUIRED if both

isFullscreen() and GetDisplayMode() are not in fullscreen mode.



Bug: 40247044

entry.content:

enabled, request digital zoom when calling ConfigureStreams. The request

is done by setting CrosDigitalZoomRequested vendor key to session

parameters in the stream config.

entry.title: run_all_fuzzers.py: cleanups, ~no functional changes
entry.content:
This CL is primarily about cleaning up recent changes to this script,

which is used when gathering fuzzer code coverage.



It has a few minor functional changes:



* It logs progress as it goes through the hundreds of fuzzers.

* It unlinks profraw files after they've been merged into profdata

files, likely saving quite a bit of disk space.

* It integrates several separate print statements into one, such that

the different parallel jobs don't interleave so much (and generally

tweaks the logging a little).



The major changes here are non-functional though:

* Abstract out a function for actually running the fuzzers

* Abstract out a function for performing llvm-profdata merge



Bug: 326493647

Change-Id: I68a6972004e4790921d270ef13d8ff962f29a355

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5361940

entry.title: Hooks up `SetViewport` and adds placeholders for the other APIs.
entry.content:
This patch changes the accessibility code for Backlight (AKA the Media

App), so that it calls `SetViewport` in the Media App whenever assistive

software performs a programmatic scroll of the content.

It also adds placeholders where the remaining APIs should be called

whenever they are implemented and the Mojom file

describing them is updated in Backlight.

entry.title: Skip processing DispatchLoad calls on commit-intercepted RFHs
entry.content:
In tests, we can intercept DidCommit navigation callbacks to keep the

navigation in a "pending commit" stage. If this happens on a new RFH,

the RFH will also stay in the kPendingCommit state. However, since

the renderer thought it already sent the DidCommit IPC and the RFH

is now active, we might receive some IPCs that should only be called

on active RFHs, e.g. DispatchLoad, causing failed DCHECKs.



In this CL, we keep track of whether we've intercepted a commit on

a RFH before, and skip processing DispatchLoad in that case. This

shouldn't have any effect outside of tests.



Bug: 936696

entry.title: win: fix settings app monitor user actions recording.
entry.content:
Some user actions from the settings app are missed because the

DefaultBrowserActionRecorder is deleted before the ui automation events

are processed. This CL makes us wait 5 seconds after getting registry

changed notifications before concluding the systems setting interaction.

This will allow us time to process the ui automation events and record

what the user did. Although waiting 5 seconds is a bit arbitrary, it's

a lot simpler and less error prone than trying to wait for ui

automation events and should greatly improve the accuracy of the stats.

entry.title: [//media] Enable 2c pure-SW VideoFrame->GL upload w/Metal, non-OOP-C
entry.content:
This CL enables 2-copy upload of pure software VideoFrames to GL when

ANGLE-Metal and non-OOP-C are being used. The thing that we need to do

in this case is create the intermediate SharedImage that holds the YUV

data of the VideoFrame via GLTextureImageBacking rather than

IOSurfaceImageBacking, as the latter doesn't support I420 as a format.



GLTextureImageBackingFactory rejects creation of

SharedImages with GLES2 usage when ANGLE-Metal is being used, as those

could be used on a different GPU than raster. However, in this case

the GLES2 usage is present *only* because we know that raster is going

over the GLES2 interface - the intermediate SI is not actually accessed

by WebGL, as it is first copied to an RGBA SI that itself is then copied

to a GL texture via WebGL's GLES2 interface. GLTextureImageBacking will

allow creation of SharedImages if it knows that the SI is in this case

via the client specifying SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_FOR_RASTER_ONLY.



For Graphite, we have an additional issue wherein we disallow

GLTextureImageBacking creation for SIs with raster usage, since raster

might not be using GL. However, in this case we *know* that raster is

going over the GLES2 interface, and thus it is fine to use

GLTextureImageBacking. GLTexture similarly will allow creation of

SharedImages in this case via the client specifying the

RASTER_OVER_GLES2_ONLY flag.



This CL adds both usages to the intermediate SI, as well as unittests

of GLTextureImageBackingFactory that specifically test that it allows

creation of SharedImages matching the parameters given for that

intermediate SI.



I have verified that this CL fixes the Google Earth crash from [1] with

Ganesh and Graphite.



I will also be developing a regression test of the high-level use case

here (import of pure-SW video frames to WebGL).



[1] https://issues.chromium.org/u/1/issues/328302269



Bug: 328472684

entry.title: Fix V8 fuzzer dictionary names.
entry.content:
For v8 fuzzers, and possibly for some others, the use of

"invoker.target_name" was giving us the wrong target name and causing us

to specify the wrong dictionary name inside the fuzzer options file.

(This is because for those fuzzers, target_name did not match

invoker.target_name due to the "v8_fuzzer" template).



This fixes that bug by creating a new fuzzer_name variable.

entry.title: [css-nesting-1] Reject :has() within :has() due to nesting.
entry.content:
We already reject nested :has() parse-time, but it is possible

to construct it somewhat more implicitly, using CSS Nesting.

Detect the situation during selector checking, and refuse

the match.



There are a number of unknown questions in the spec, such as

how this should interact with :not() and whether such rejection

should change any other rules' specificity or not, but at least

this takes us out of potential exponential time and increases

interop.



Fixed: 324916796

entry.title: [iOS] Update TabStrip move
entry.content:
This CL updates how the TabStrip is handling the move operation.

In particular, it is adding a method to move the item instead of

reloading all of them.



It is also fixing a bug where the check to know if a cell was reused

or not was using the visibility of the cell in the Collection View.

This is not working for drag and drop as the cell is not considered

visible when dropped, so there was an early return creating an empty

favicon.



It is also fixing a few stylistic issues wrt to first letter being

lowercase.

6716444483ab42670ebfd6d7d51653242a3477d5 is that the bool

entry.title: Update FormTracker using blink form mutation signal.
entry.content:
Previously Autofill used to use a WebFormElementObserver in order to

track elements disappearing for submission detection purposes.



E.g. When XHR happens, if the tracked element had disappeared by then,

we infer form submission, but if the element disappears later we would

need another mechanism to check that. This observer was the needed mechanism.



Given that this was not strong enough as a signal to detect hidden

elements (only detects display: none) a signal was introduced in a prior

CL from blink to Autofill for when elements are added, removed or

hidden.



In this CL, we use the kRemoved and kHide signals to inform FormTracker

that maybe the tracked element disappeared, and in that case,

FormTracker can maybe infer form submission.



The observer was used for 3 cases:

- XHR, then tracked element disappeared.

- Same document navigation, then tracked element disappeared.

- (PWM only) Autofilled element then tracked element disappeared.



This CL therefore introduces 4 booleans representing each one of those

cases + a boolean that tracks if the tracked element disappeared or not.

This way we only infer submission for event X if both event_x_happened

and tracked_element_disappeared booleans are set to true.



This CL also disables the use of the observer.



Lastly, the CL drops the form extraction done in GetSubmittedForm, as

this would cause problems when called from within a style recalc in

blink. Instead, it uses `provisionally_saved_form_` unconditionally

and so the submitted form would be the version of the form last edited

by the user.



When the introduced feature is disabled, this CL is a no-op. All changes described previously are gated by the added feature flag.



Bug: 1483242

Change-Id: Ib1793841a8a0dbf8bc3dff3244cce82809e00853

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5041251

Reviewed-by: Mohamed Amir Yosef

entry.title: [ChromeSigninBubble] Update the intercept logic
entry.content:
Added a new pref to remember the user choice on the bubble if

accept/decline is chosen. Also added a new pref to count the number of

dimisses. Those two prefs are stored per account/profile.



Based on the user choice, the next web sign in will be impacted:

- accepted: lead to automatic sign in.

- declined: leads to no sign in and no show of the bubble.

- dismissed: count the number of dismisses. When the max is reached,

treat the result as a decline. Max is currently set to 5.



Also changed the way Uno responds to ACCESS_POINT_WEB_SIGNIN:

Since we now remember the user choice, a sign in with an

ACCESS_POINT_WEB_SIGNIN could result in an automatic signin

based on the user previous choice from settings/bubble.

Also we do not reset the explicit browser signin pref, instead we

just keep it as is.



Added browser tests to cover the new behavior.



Also split test into Full and/or experimental modes for clarity:

- Tests with full and experimental mode: some tests are needed for

both modes with some slight differences.

- Tests with full mode only, changes that do not affect the experiment.

- Tests with experiment mode only, tests the old behavior that got updated in this CL (That should be removed when we stop supporting

the experiment soon).



Added `Signin.Intercept.ChromeSignin.DismissesBeforeAccept/Decline` which replaced `Signin.Intercept.ChromeSignin.AttemptsBeforeAccept` with a more accurate count given the new behavior. Keeping the old

histogram for the experiment phase that is still on going.

entry.title: [//gpu][mac] Support Viz multiple concurrent read access in Dawn SI rep
entry.content:
The compositor keeps its accesses open until draw (rather than closing

and restarting them throughout the process) if the Skia representation

returns true for SupportsMultipleConcurrentReadAccess(). This can reduce

overhead.



The semantic constraints for a representation being able to return true

are the following:



* It is valid to call BeginScopedReadAccess() concurrently on two

different representations of the same image.

* The backing supports true concurrent read access rather than emulating

concurrent reads by "pausing" a first read when a second read of a

different representation type begins, which requires that the second

representation's read finish within the scope of its GPU task in order

to ensure that nothing actually accesses the first representation

while it is paused. Some backings that support only exclusive access

from the SI perspective do the latter (e.g.,

ExternalVulkanImageBacking as its "support" of concurrent GL and

Vulkan access). SupportsMultipleConcurrentReadAccess() results in the

compositor's read access being long-lived (i.e., beyond the scope of

a single GPU task).



The Graphite Skia representation returns true if the underlying Dawn

representation does so. The Dawn Mac representation meets both of the

above constraints, and so this CL enables

SupportsMultipleConcurrentReadAccess().



I have tested rendering locally in a variety of use cases, and

everything works.



Bug: 41496467

Change-Id: I2fe32600703117187c232f0c87e678780f2ded48

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5355688

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Sunny Sachanandani

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271451}

entry.title: Saved the default search engine location choice to a pref
entry.content:
This CL adds pref "default_search_provider_data.choice_location" which

stores the location of the default search engine choice. This preference

is stored every time the default search engine preference is updated.



This CL also adds the following logic to read the choice made location:

a) if the source of the default search engine is FROM_USER, then the

value of the pref default_search_provider_data.choice_location

is used.

b) if the source of the default search engine is anything else, then

ChoiceMadeLocation::kOther is used.



Fixed: b/326969414

entry.title: CertificateManagerModel: Import PKCS#12 into Kcer only on NSS success
entry.content:
Only attempt to dual-write PKCS#12 certificates into Kcer when

NSS succeeds. This is important in case of a rollback when all

Kcer-imported certificates would be deleted.



Bug: b/264387231

entry.title: native occlusion: Mark content window as visible or not
entry.content:
This CL adds behavior to DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform to set the

content window visibility based on the native occlusion state, if

native occlusion affecting the UI compositor is enabled.



This mimics the existing behavior for minimizing with native occlusion

off, which sets the UI compositor and content window visibility to

false.

entry.title: Printing: Render document contents before headers / footers.
entry.content:
This is what the spec expects. It currently shouldn't affect the output,

though, since the document contents, which is rendered by Blink,

currently cannot overlap with the headers and footers. However, doing it

in this order will be necessary once we add support for @page

backgrounds, which should be painted under headers and footers, not on

top of them.



This change affects one accessibility test, though, which assumed that

the text that it was looking for was the last accessibility node, which

will no longer be the case.

to the one that we're computing and using via ClientSharedImage. This

code simplicity) is that we remove calls to legacy functions for

computing the texture target.

entry.title: [keepalive-migration] Revamp UMA logging
entry.content:
The removed UMAs were added throughout the time the migration was

implemented. There are duplications, missing logs for some non-fetch

keepalive requests, and they are not easy to use for analysis.



This CL replaces them with a series of new metrics that are consistent

and simple to use, and logs most of them by keepalive request type.

See [1] for the full picture.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/15MHmkf_SN2S9WYra060yEChgjs3pgZW--aHUuiG8Y1Q/edit





OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Metrics]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Total.Browser

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Started]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Started.Browser

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Finished]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.ReceivedResponse]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Succeeded.Browser

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total.Redirected]=Remove

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Browser.Total]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Total.Browser



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Metrics]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Total.Renderer

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Total.Renderer

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Finished]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Started]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Started.Renderer

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.ReceivedResponse]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.Requests.Succeeded.Renderer

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Total.Redirected]=Removed



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Duration]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.RequestDuration

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Duration.Succeeded]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.RequestDuration.Succeeded

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.Duration.Failed]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.RequestDuration.Failed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.DurationAfterDetached]=Replaced by FetchKeepAlive.RequestOutliveDuration

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.DurationAfterDetached.Succeeded]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[FetchKeepAlive.Renderer.DurationAfterDetached.Failed]=Removed



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.Total]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.AfterDetached.IsSuccess]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.AfterDetached.Duration]=Removed

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Blink.Fetch.KeepAlive.Total.IsSuccess]=Removed

entry.title: [FspCache] Add CacheManagerObserver
entry.content:
Add a CacheManager observer called CacheManagerObserver. This observes

when providers are initialised through the

CacheManager::InitializeForProvider() method.



This allows FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystemTest unit tests to be able

to wait on the asynchronous initialisation of the CloudFileSystem before

proceeding with the test. The asynchronous part is the

CacheManager::InitializeForProvider() call. This functionality will be

used in the tests of http://crrev.com/c/5362655.

entry.title: components: Fix tests which rely on overriding LocalFrame
entry.content:
These tests rely on LocalFrame initialization being deferred to after

simulating a navigation commit. With the introduction of pageswap event,

the LocalFrame is now implicitly initializing during the commit.



Fix the tests by explicitly resetting the LocalFrame when setting up

the override

entry.title: Update doc to reflect device_management service
entry.content:
A new service named `device_management` is responsible for serving install_attributes and fwmp related attributes. The install-time attributes are now being saved inside `/var/lib/device_management` instead of `/home/.shadow`. So we should include that path in the doc as well.

entry.title: [ios] Avoid LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node() to verify belonging
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



This patch is part of a larger series to remove all callers for

LegacyBookmarkModel::root_node(), which doesn't have clear semantics

during the transition phase while feature

`syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is rolling out.



For cases where the root is only used to verify whether or not a node is

a descendant, the more robust alternative is to extend

LegacyBookmarkModel with a dedicated API for this purpose. This allows

LegacyBookmarkModelWithSharedUnderlyingModel to implement equivalent

logic properly.



Bug: 326185948

Change-Id: Ib270c43083ebed59d24e517578509ef93d228e71

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5358399

entry.title: Track provisional_frame_for_local_root_swap_ in RenderFrameImpl with a WeakPtr
entry.content:
It's possible for a frame to be detached while in the middle of a

navigation commit on a provisional RenderFrame. See repro test at

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/navigation/resources/reentrant-eventsource-onerror-crash-during-commit-iframe.html.



In this case, if the navigation commits on a provisional RenderFrame,

the provisional RenderFrame will be deleted first, before the previous

RenderFrame. Since we track provisional_frame_for_local_root_swap_

as a raw_ptr in the previous RenderFrame, this hits the dangling ptr

check. To avoid that, track the provisioanl RenderFarme with a WeakPtr

instead. It's ok to do that since if the frame is getting detached

there is no need to do anything to the provisional RenderFrame.



Bug: 936696

Change-Id: I8e855a21b30e2f1fbfb6def712bc29e79ed01ea1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5359220

Commit-Queue: Rakina Zata Amni

Reviewed-by: Fergal Daly

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271384}

entry.title: Reland: LinkPreview: Add alt+hover and long press triggers
entry.content:
This CL relands https://crrev.com/c/5107229.



The differences are



- This CL uses raw information e.g. WebInputEvent::Button instead of

WebMouseEventBuilder because layout object is not available in some

cases. See also b/327651304.

entry.title: Add UMA for deleteing queue directories in missive.
entry.content:
Add a UMA boolean log to track the success/failure of deleting empty multigeneration queue directories. A value of `true` indicates that no errors occurred while attempting to delete directories and that zero or more directories were deleted. `false` indicates that at least one directory that should have been deleted was not deleted due to an error.

entry.title: [FspCache] Introduce map of operation IDs to file handles
entry.content:
Previously, the caller of a CloudFileSystem::OpenFile request would be

returned the file handle created by the underlying FSP OpenFile request.



Instead, the CloudFileSystem should assign a new operation ID upon a

successful underlying FSP OpenFile request. This operation ID will be

returned to the caller and will be used by the caller to communicate

with the CloudFileSystem regarding the opened file.



The CloudFileSystem will still use the file handle to communicate with

the underlying FSP by mapping each incoming operation ID to the file

handle created by the underlying FSP. This mapping will be deleted upon

file close.



The motivation for this change is so that in the future, a unique

mapping can be made between disk backed operations (identified by a disk

FD) and cloud backed FSP operations (identified by a file handle). The 2

operations may return identifiers that clash and any requests for a

clashing identifier would be difficult to disambiguate.



Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystemTest*

Bug: b/328670254

Change-Id: I9884f90ebbbcc6b2e4d1aa2628a79560c98858eb
